cells.data: When you have block level elements and you set a margin for them, the margin on the top and bottom levels will combine. So if I set margin to 10 px and have to blocks stacked, instead of there being 20px between them there will only be 10 px.

The inline elements will ignore top and bottom margin. But left and right margin will not combine like block level elements. So if I set a 10 px margin then the top and bottom will be ignored, and then you will have 20 px between the items.
The inline-block elements have behavior like both inline and block. So the inline-block elements have a top left bottom and right margin.
This completely gets rid of any margin and tries to treat the element as though it was the cell of a table.
